Sentencas: Design-point and part-load characteristics of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) system, fuelled by methane and hydrogen, are investigated for its prospective use in the residential application.
Titulo: Evaluation of hydrogen and methane-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential applications: System design alternative and parameter study

Sentencas: As a part of this activity, a detailed SOFC cell model is developed, evaluated and extended to a stack model.
Titulo: Evaluation of hydrogen and methane-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential applications: System design alternative and parameter study

Sentencas: Models of all the required balance of plant components are also developed and are integrated to build a system model.
Titulo: Evaluation of hydrogen and methane-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential applications: System design alternative and parameter study

Sentencas: Using this model, two system base cases for methane and hydrogen fuels are introduced.
Titulo: Evaluation of hydrogen and methane-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential applications: System design alternative and parameter study

Sentencas: Cogeneration relevant performance figures are investigated for different system configurations and cell parameters i.e. fuel utilization, fuel flow rate, operation voltage and extent of internal fuel reforming.
Titulo: Evaluation of hydrogen and methane-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential applications: System design alternative and parameter study

Sentencas: The results show high combined heat and power efficiencies for both cases, with higher thermal-to-electric ratio and lower electric efficiency for the hydrogen-fuelled cases.
Titulo: Evaluation of hydrogen and methane-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential applications: System design alternative and parameter study

Sentencas: Performance improvements with radiation air pre-heaters and anode gas recycling are presented and the respective application limits discussed.
Titulo: Evaluation of hydrogen and methane-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential applications: System design alternative and parameter study
